question_text: Which configuration provides the highest throughput for an internal SSD?
answer_options: SATA III SSD on a 6 Gbps port
M.2 NVMe SSD using 4 PCIe lanes
correct_answer: M.2 NVMe SSD using 4 PCIe lanes
explanation: NVMe drives using PCIe x4 can achieve far higher throughput than SATA-based solutions, including M.2 SATA.
